metadata.dc:author: Díez, E
Boixeda, P
metadata.dc:description: Frey's syndrome, also known as auriculotemporal syndrome is characterized by recurrent episodes of facial flushing and/or sweating along the distribution of the auriculotemporal nerve, that occurs in response to gustatory stimuli. The disorder is rare in children. We report a 4-year-old girl with flushing without hyperhidrosis in the left cheek on eating.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Frey en la infancia.
[Frey's sydrome in childhood].
